item.title: US shipping 2.58M more COVID-19 vaccine doses to Philippines
item.description: The US government will begin shipping 2.58 million more doses of COVID-19 vaccine to the Philippines on Thursday through the COVAX global distribution program, a White House official said on Thursday.

item.title: Australia agrees to increased US air deployments after sub deal
item.description: Australia and the United States announced expanded military cooperation on Thursday, including rotational deployments of all types of US military aircraft to Australia, a day after announcing a submarine deal denounced by China as intensifying a regional arms race.

item.title: Japan issues alert after volcano erupts
item.description: Japan issued an alert on Friday after a volcano in the southwest of the country erupted, jettisoning large rocks hundreds of metres away from the crater, Kyodo news agency reported.

item.title: Venezuela uses judicial system to suppress dissent, UN investigators say
item.description: Venezuela's judicial system has perpetuated human rights violations as part of a state policy to quash opposition to the government of President Nicolas Maduro, a group of United Nations investigators said on Thursday.

item.title: Italy makes COVID-19 health pass mandatory for all workers
item.description: The Italian government approved on Thursday some of the strictest anti-COVID measures in the world, making it obligatory for all workers either to show proof of vaccination, a negative test or recent recovery from infection.

item.title: Outcry as Faroe Islands slaughter 1,400 dolphins in a day
item.description: The government of the Faroe Islands, an autonomous Danish territory, faced an outcry on Tuesday over the culling of more than 1,400 white-sided dolphins in a day in what was said to be the single biggest hunt in the northern archipelago.

item.title: WHO: Guinea declares end of Marburg virus outbreak
item.description: Guinea has declared the end of an outbreak of the Marburg virus, which belongs to the same family as Ebola, the World Health Organization (WHO) said Thursday.

item.title: Paglaban ng isang babae sa rider na nanghipo sa kaniyang dibdib, nahuli-cam
item.description: Sapul sa CCTV camera ang ginawang paghipo ng isang rider sa dibdib ng isang babae sa Jaro, Iloilo City. Pero sa halip na masindak ang babae, lumaban siya at tinangkang mahuli ang rider.

item.title: Davao City gov't requires COVID-19 jabs for employees
item.description: All Davao City government employees are required to have themselves vaccinated against the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), according to the directive of Mayor Sara Duterte.

item.title: HPAAC to gov t: Fix inadequacies in data reporting amid new lockdown scheme
item.description: Healthcare Professionals Alliance Against COVID-19 (HPAAC) on Thursday urged the national government to fix "inadequacies" in its reporting system, which it uses as the basis for the new alert level system in Metro Manila.

item.title: Breadwinner na food delivery rider, hinoldap; P19k na pera, natangay
item.description: Na-trauma at nawala ang kita sa buong araw na pagtatrabaho ng isang food delivery rider nang holdapin siya ng tatlong lalaki sa Dagupan City, Pangasinan. Ang biktima, breadwinner sa kanilang pamilya.

item.title: Former Northern Samar congressman Emil Ong dies
item.description: Former Northern Samar 2nd District Representative Emil Ong passed away on Thursday.

item.title: Delivery rider killed after being run over by truck
item.description: A delivery rider succumbed to serious injuries after his motorcyle was rammed by a truck on Thursday evening.

item.title: PUP grad tops Electrical Engineering Licensure exams
item.description: A graduate from the Polytechnic University of the Philippines (PUP) in Sta. Mesa bested 1,668 successful examinees of the September 2021 registered Electrical Engineer Licensure Examinations, according to the results published by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC).

item.title: Quiapo church reopens for fully vaccinated devotees, unvaccinated pray outside
item.description: After the government placed Metro Manila under Alert Level 4, Quiapo Church in Manila on Thursday only allowed fully vaccinated visitors to enter the church while the unvaccinated stay outside.
